body_html: @gangele397 @qdk0901Another easy solution. If you're under GFW, you can try the image of tensorflow in Docker Hub instead of Google's Cloud Platform. In your terminal, just run sudo docker run -it -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow instead of running sudo docker run -it -p 8888:8888 b.gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow. It works for me. Hope it is helpful for you guys.

body: @gangele397 @qdk0901Another easy solution. If you're under GFW, you can try the image of tensorflow in Docker Hub instead of Google's Cloud Platform. In your terminal, just run `sudo docker run -it -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow` instead of running `sudo docker run -it -p 8888:8888 b.gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow`. It works for me. Hope it is helpful for you guys.
